body:
### Steps to reproduce

```console
$ spack solve zlib
[ ... ]
$ ls $SPACK_ROOT/share/spack/modules/
linux-rhel5-x86_64  linux-ubuntu20.04-icelake
```
Similarly for `lmod` if it is enabled in `modules.yaml`

### Error message

No errors, but since module files are not needed during bootstrapping they should be disabled. This issue has been firstly reported on Slack by @mwkrentel  (in his case an incomplete configuration of `lmod` was causing failures in the bootstrapping procedure).

### Information on your system

Not relevant for the bug, but:

* **Spack:** 0.16.2-4165-c424b86a64
* **Python:** 3.8.10
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu20.04-icelake
* **Concretizer:** original


### General information

- [X] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [X] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
title: Module files are being generated during bootstrapping
